alert.note: Alert for Chatham (North Carolina) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Warning issued December 18 at 6:29AM EST until December 19 at 12:20PM EST by NWS Raleigh
info.description: ...The Flood Warning continues for the following rivers in North Carolina... Haw River Near Bynum affecting Chatham County. ...FLOOD WARNING NOW IN EFFECT UNTIL EARLY TOMORROW AFTERNOON... * WHAT...Minor flooding is occurring and minor flooding is forecast. * WHERE...Haw River near Bynum. * WHEN...Until early tomorrow afternoon. * IMPACTS...At 11.0 feet, Minor flooding begins. The river widens up to 400 feet across. It floods pastureland on the right bank and woodlands on the left. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 6:00 AM EST Monday the stage was 11.7 feet. - Bankfull stage is 10.0 feet. - Recent Activity...The maximum river stage in the 24 hours ending at 6:00 AM EST Monday was 11.9 feet. - Forecast...The river is expected to rise to a crest of 12.7 feet this afternoon. It will then fall below flood stage just after midnight tonight. - Flood stage is 11.0 feet. - Flood History...This crest compares to a previous crest of 12.1 feet on 10/13/2018. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood && Fld Observed Forecasts (7 am EST) Location Stg Stg Day/Time Tue Wed Thu Fri Haw River Bynum 11.0 11.7 Mon 6 am EST 9.4 6.5 5.2 4.8 &&
info.instruction: Motorists should not attempt to drive around barricades or drive cars through flooded areas. Additional information is available at www.weather.gov/rah/rivers. The next statement will be issued this evening at 630 PM EST.
